英文法規名稱: Regulations Governing the Application of Business Registration
沿革內容:
1. Promulgated on March 23 , 2009
2. Amended on August 05 , 2009
3. Amended on November 12, 2010
4. Amended on September 22, 2011
5. Amended on February 13, 2014
6. Amended on September 06, 2016

法規內容.條文內容: This Regulation is prescribed pursuant to Article 15, Paragraph 2 of the Business Registration Act (hereinafter referred to as the "Act").

I.The applicant may prepare the application form and documents in the form of electronic documents prefixed with authorized electronic signature and may transmit the application package via electronic network.
II.Electronic signature as required in the preceding paragraph shall be prefixed to the document using the business identification card issued by the Certificate Authority of the Ministry of Economic Affairs, if the applicant is a business; or using the natural person identification card issued by the Certificate Authority of the Ministry of Interior, if the applicant is a natural person.

A person with limited disposing capacity operating a business independently or being a partner of a partnership shall obtain the consent from his/her statutory representative or agent. In applying for various business registrations, such person shall submit the written consent of the statutory representative or agent.
A person under assistance operating a business independently or being a partner of a partnership shall obtain the consent of his/her assistant. In applying for various business registrations, such person shall submit the written consent of the assistant.

If the scope of businesses shall be approved by the relevant competent authorities in charge of the business in accordance with the laws or regulations, the applicant shall submit the approvals from the relevant competent authorities in charge of the business in applying for various business registrations.

If any change in the particulars of business registration, an application for amendment to the registration shall be filed by submitting the application form and one of the following documents depending on the change of the particular:
1. Change of the responsible person: identification document of the responsible person; in the case of partnership, the written consents of the partners or the partnership agreement shall also be submitted.
2. Change of the partners: identification documents of the partners and the written consents of the partners or the partnership agreement.
3. Change of the capital: the capital certificate; in the case that the capital is less than NTD 250,000 after capital increase or in the case of capital decrease, the capital certificate is not required; in the case of partnership, the written consents of the partners or the partnership agreement shall also be submitted.
4. Change of the location: the ownership certificate of the building where the business is located; in the case that the owner is not the responsible person of the business or a partner, the written consent of the owner shall be attached. The ownership certificate of the building can be substituted by the transcript of the building, the tax registration proof of the building, the most recent building tax statement or other documents which can prove the owner of the building. The written consent of the owner can be substituted by the lease agreement signed between the business and the owner or the lease agreement signed between the business responsible person and the owner specifying that the building can be used for business registration or for business use; in the case of partnership, the written consents of the partners or the partnership agreement shall also be submitted.
5. Change of the business name, scope of businesses or other amendments to registration: the certificate of the amendment; in the case of partnership, the written consents of the partners or the partnership agreement shall also be submitted.
6. Change of the transfer of capital contributions: the transfer agreement; in the case of partnership, the written consents of the partners or the partnership agreement shall also be submitted.

A business changing its organization from sole proprietorship to partnership and applying for the amendment to registration shall submit the following documents:
1.the application form;
2.the identification documents of the responsible person and partners; and
3.the partnership agreement.

I. In applying for change of the business address pursuant to Article 16 of the Act, the applicant shall submit items 4 of Article 6 of this Regulations and the following documents to the competent authority having jurisdiction over the district where the business will move into:
1. the application form;
2. the identification document of the responsible person; in the case of partnership, the identification documents of the partners and the partnership agreement shall also be submitted.
II. In applying for change of the registration according to the preceding paragraph, if the business name of the applicant is the same with a registered business name in the jurisdiction where the business will move into, after being notified by the competent authority having jurisdiction over the district where the business will move into, the applicant shall correct and reapply therefor.

I.A business temporarily suspends its business shall apply for suspension registration by submitting the application form; in the case of partnership, the written consents of partners shall also be submitted.
II.The preceding paragraph shall apply mutatis mutandis to the resumption registration of a business.
A business terminates its business shall apply for termination registration by submitting the application form; in the case of partnership, the written consents of partners shall also be submitted.

When a statutory representative or an agent operating a registered business for a person who lacks disposing capacity or has only limited disposing capacity, the statutory representative or the agent, by submitting the identification documents, shall apply for the registration of operation by agent.

A business branch terminates its business shall apply for the termination registration by submitting the application form; in the case of partnership, the written consents of partners shall also be submitted.

When an alternation of the location of business, the addresses of the responsible person or the partners resulted from rezoning of administrative zones or reassignment of door numbers, an amendment to registration shall be filed by submitting the supporting documents of such reassignment of door numbers.
In the case of two businesses using the same business name resulted from rezoning of administrative zones, the businesses may continue using their business names.

The reasons for applying for correction of registration in accordance with Article 24 of the Act are limited to errors or omissions in words; if the correction involves the contents of registration, an application for an amendment to registration shall be filed.

The documents governing by these Regulations may be the copies of the originals, except that the application form shall be the original. The competent authority having jurisdiction over the district where the business is located may notify the applicant to attach the originals, if necessary.

These regulations shall be effective on April 13, 2009.
The amendments to these Regulations shall take effect as the date of promulgation hereof.
The amendments to these Regulations made on Nov. 12, 2010, shall be effective on Dec. 25, 2010.
